content: Find an example of a C Major 7th chord on a piano.

A C Major 7th chord on the piano consists of four notes: C, E, G, and B. 

To play this chord:

1. Start with the note C. This is the root of the chord.
2. Next, play the note E. This is the major third.
3. Then, play the note G. This is the perfect fifth.
4. Finally, play the note B. This is the major seventh.

When played together, these notes form a C Major 7th chord, offering a rich and harmonious sound.
